If you were faced with two roses - one dull but thornless, one beautiful but thorned - which would you choose?

I hate being presented with decisions.  I'm so indecisive, and there's always some excuse as to why I have to choose one or the other, flip-flopping back and forth all the time.  I never know which path to follow, if my final (but entirely unsure) decision is the better or right choice.  Perhaps one day I'll have the courage and strength to pick a side, to follow through, to do what I want without fearing the consequences...  Until then, I guess I'll just have to keep sitting on my cloud, watching the world around me grow.

Maybe someone will come along and show me the way...

Yay for updates! I've been wanting to do this for a while...I just needed the push to do it. So thanks, Ish. Anyhow, so today my dad and I went to check out a couple of college campuses (I was so tempted to write "campi") and eat BBQ. Well, it was mainly for college, but we got hungry along the way. :) So first we went to UNT... *gag* I know it's an old school and all, but they could still take better care of it. Over-all, it really wasn't impressive. And the environment? Ew. Ashley, if you recall our little trip to the edge of civilization...it was bad. Like, run-down, middle-of-nowhere bad. So ick for Denton. After that we drove to UTD (correction: first we went all over creation to FIND a Starbucks, where we got Green Tea Frappuccinos, which were quite yummy, might I add). I have two words for you: Holy Wow. For a local campus, you can't find better. It's in Richardson (near Plano) so it's by all kinds of good stuff - nice neighborhoods, good restaurants and stores, etc. Plus, the campus itself is AMAZING. I love the architecture, and the whole layout is very inviting and community-oriented. I can definitely see myself there... So Ashley, if you want to take a college day or two, we can go up and talk to admissions counselors and tours and all that jazz. I think it would be fun... It's a nice campus, and instead of dorms, they have APARTMENTS!!! They're nifty and nice-looking, and we could request to have the same apartment if you wanted to. Living there isn't cheap ($366/month without phone service (who needs it with cell phones?) and cable), plus you have to bring your own furniture, but it would be kinda nice to get out of the house. *shrugs* So yeah, if anyone, ANYONE, wants to take a college day and go up there with me...let me know! It would be fuuuuuuuuun. *nods* Anyway, it's 11 PM, and I should get to bed... Hopefully I'll update my layout and finish my essay for UTD tomorrow! 'Night! <3 lauren

This thing needs a little bit of TLC every now and then. 'Cause I'm not gonna be like you-know-who and waste e-space... I've got a website to do that for me. XD So, in the time since I last updated, I...well...haven't changed much. My beliefs, goals, and personality have become more concrete. I'm still lazy, ambitious, giddy, shy, outgoing, blonette... Basically an ambiguous, enigmatic, incredibly redundant conundrum wrapped up in fatigue and apathy. And while that makes no sense, neither do I. I know who I am, what I do, but I can never predict my future actions. I know what I want to do with my life, and yet my plans split in many different directions. Do I want to stay in-state, or go out-of-state for college? What exact profession do I want go after? When and how do I tell people what needs to be said? Do I contradict society openly, or with those closest to me? I know what needs to be done; I'm just not sure of how to go through with it, or if I have the courage. I often compensate for my lack of boldness by being...well...bold. And while none of this makes sense to any of you, I can assure you it will in due time. One night (one of the nights that changed my life in a way), as I lay in bed, I began to mull things over in my head. Why do I do things? What makes me feel the way I do? What do I want from life? Who am I? It was at that last question that I came to a conclusion. No matter how far down you delve into beliefs, my personality, you're never done. You get so close, but can never reach it. Just think of it like this: You've got a variable, x. And the problem begins: Find the limit as x approaches infinity. So you take your equation, gather all of your data, and draw a graph. What do you find? Do you ever reach the limit? Of course not. You can come infinitly close, but the line never reaches its destination. It's like a never-ending quest you spend all your life on. In the end, I had mentally compiled a list of well over 100 words to describe myself, and would have continued had I not been so tired. And, you're probably wondering, what was on that list? Like myself, I can sum it all up in one word: CONTRADICTION. For every definition, there was an opposite. Outgoing, yet shy. Intelligent, yet ditzy. Firm believer in nothing. Ambitious, yet lazy. Attached, yet apathetic. Insert any word for part A, and part B will be equally true. Innocent, yet devilish. Pacifist, yet violent. Girly, yet tomboyish. For so long, I've been so unsure of everything; now, more than ever, I'm so concrete. It's amazing how one person, one night, can change everything you know. I'm sure you'll never know Who you are But you made me new And with these answers, a whole new set of questions appear...

I'm another year older, another year wiser...but now what? I'm 17. Am I supposed to be excited? Is there a switch in my brain in the wrong position? Or am I really becoming more of an adult than I though possible? It's official. I'm an empty shell, all emotions sucked out of me. It's so easy to put on a mask for everyone to see. Maybe it's just a phase; maybe it'll pass right through me. But days upon days of endless, restless waking hours are starting to drain me, slowly. I'm so numb, I can't even feel the tingle it usually brings me. But why? Am I stuck in this life, doomed to eternal emptiness? This hollow distress is killing me...

Gar!  Stupid lamp.  Took me four times to get the thing to turn on this time.  Anwho, wow!  It's an update from the procrastination queen!  Actually, this is (was) originally written in a spiral, starting at 1:28 in the morning.  Hey, it's gotta start somewhere, right?  I had an unexhausting night at work, so I've got plenty of energy to FINALLY write an update.  Woot!

Ok, so first off, work.  I'm the queen of night-shifts now.  That's all I work...  And let me tell you, working a six-hour shift and having to defrost the ghea at the end of it...  THAT's pretty exhausting.  Good thing it's only done on Thursdays and Sundays.  Hah...  That reminds me, Thursday, after I had gotten done taking all of the ice cream out of the ghea, Amber wanted me to help her lift the buscart, full of ice cream, mind you, into the walk-in freezer.  Well, seeing how there were 18 pans of ice cream, I knew I couldn't do it, but thought I'd try anyway.  *snort*  Silly me.  I tried, but failed miserably.  After a few attempts, Amber finally declared that I was "weighing down the cart even more."  My response?  "Oh my gosh...  I'm so weak, you have no idea."  Of course, she sat there and laughed at me.  But hey, when doesn't she?  Eh, I love my people.  :D  Which reminds me...  My crush on Kendall?  Absolutely finito.  Oh yeah, quick question - do any of y'all know ANYONE who goes by the name of Suzy?  That name's too generic...  Eh, maybe my paranoia/naturally suspicious nature (redundant much?) is getting the best of me.  Again.  Hmmm...  We'll just have to wait and see, I guess.  But enough of my rambling.  On to more important matters...

...like losing my $300 class ring.  Shya.  My mom was absolutely LIVID when she found out...  Thank God my dad still doesn't know yet.  I'm planning on paying the $80/90 to get them to send me a new one.  I mean, it's not like I don't have the money...  *sigh*

Oh yeah, yesterday Ashley and I went SHOPPING!!!  Woot!  I love tax-free weekend...  I got a whole new outfit (minus the shoes - and oh yeah, Ashley, I'll probably be coming over later to get mine :D), a purse, and my loverly purple shoes.  *squee*  Yay!  And guess what...  NINE DAYS 'TIL MY BIRTHDAY!!!!!!!  I'm excited.  Kinda.  Sort of.  Not really.  *meh*  Growing up really isn't that exciting anymore...  I remember how, when I was little, I used to get butterflies in my stomach for a month before my birthday.  Now, it's kinda like, "Yay, woo hoo, another year older. *twirl finger*"

Come to think of it, nothing's really exciting anymore.  It's like life is at a standstill.  I'm in a trance, just watching as days pass by, one after the other.  The only thing that has been really interesting lately is a Murder Mystery (role-playing game) on a forum I regularly go to.  My mind's been on it all week (it only lasts a week), but now that it's over today, everything is back to being blah.  That's why I can't wait 'til I go to college.  I'm ready to get out of here - be on my own, meet new people, live in a new city (or state), learn to really take care of myself.  Eck.  I'm too un-excited to even write about my lack of excitement.

I'll be off...  Zeke, you better not have plans on my birthday!!!!!!!!  'Cause we're all getting together.  And maybe going wild.  Oh yeah.  :)

~*~Lackluster Lauren~*~

...I won't be here long. It's just been so long since I've updated that I thought I should post a little of what's going on in my life. School really isn't that busy right now. Which, again, is nothing special. People mainly take that class for a tech credit, so of course there will be a group of I-don't-care-about-this-class-so-I'll-sit-here-and-act-like-a-jackass kind of people, but you live. U.S. History I'm not doing so good in. We took a Ch. 39-40 quiz, and only ONE person in our entire class passed it. Go Robbie. :/ Ok, sure, if I read I would probably do better, but come on! I'm lazy, and frankly, that History book puts me to sleep. So hopefully this upcoming project will boost my C average to at LEAST a low B (hey Blaine, Kristin - remember our 60's project in 7th grade? It's baaaaaaaaaaaaack!) English is ok, I guess... I've got this week to do, like, 10 books for my concept notebook. Yeah, good luck. Plus I have my research paper that SHOULD HAVE been turned in today, but I didn't have time to finish it, so I'm going to turn it in with the band people tomorrow, and hopefully Ms. Allen won't ask questions. If she does, I'll just give her my spiel, and if she's still whining, then she can count it as a late grade. As long as I don't fail it, I'm ok (though she should give us extra time). Ok, the band people were out for two days in South Padre having fun. They get two extra days to do their research paper. Those of us taking the AP exams who are missing TWO DAYS of school for ACADEMIC reasons were supposed to turn it in a day early. Yeah, so not fair. And there's no possible way that I would've been able to get it done by Friday afternoon, so she can just take it where ever she pleases. On an upnote, I'm doing pretty well in Physics. I've got a butt-load of stuff due tomorrow, but Blaine can "help" me with the bookwork during lunch, and I can just do the online labs when Ms. Lyman's done giving notes. Oh, and did you guys know that more people signed up for AP Physics than for AP Chemistry? Weird. :/ *shrugs shoulders* Oh well, that makes me happy! Anyway, on to math...which is really easy right now. Derivitives are a gift from God. And we'll be taking a test over them tomorrow, plus we've had those quizzes that I've been getting 100's on, so my grade should raise from the 81 that I have right now to a high B. I hope. *deep breath* Other than that, there's not much going on at school, except for the fact that I'm ready for Summer Vacation. And yes, that should be capitalized, because in my book, Summer Vacation is like my birthday - I DON'T DO ANYTHING!!! Woohoo! Oh, time to move on to a new paragraph... ...Ok, much better. So summer... Not going anywhere this year. After the trip to Europe, a brand new car for my birthday, a "free" $180 letterman jacket, a $300 class ring, my brother's band trip to New York, and, as always, his karate expenses, I think we'll be cutting back on the budget this year. Plus, it'll be nice to wind down and earn a few extra bucks for those inescapable shopping days. Yes, that's right - I HAVE A JOB!!! Kristin, you're probably the only one who doesn't know, but whatever. I got a job at Coldstone at the Firewheel Mall, so if you're ever free from family/church/IB stuff and feel like getting ice cream, come by! I'll be posting my schedule every week so y'all know when I can/can't do stuff. (By the way, a "Coldstone week" is Wednesday to Tuesday, not Sunday to Saturday. I know, it's weird, but they're paying me, so I don't ask questions.) Speaking of which... I'm working tomorrow from 7 P.M.-Close, Saturday from 6 P.M.-Close, and Sunday 6 P.M.-Close. Just in case you want to stop by. :) *yawn* Alright, I was planning on writing more, but I'm worn out. It's 9:55 P.M. already, and I went on a walk and have been writing a new story which no one will get to read until I'm done, or maybe if I feel like letting you read it. But just a heads-up, it's kind of a Gregory Macguire-style book. Not the sentence format or anything, but the context. Eh, you'll get it when you read it. Anyway, I'm going to go. I might update again soon! *crosses fingers* <3 always, Lauren P.S. - Oh, by the way, I'm now officially "Mighty Midget". Yeah, don't ask.

Note: I was stupid and wrote this in first person. I got through changing all the "I"'s to "She"'s about 1/15 of the way, and said screw it. So, without further adieu, here's the story - from FIONA's point of view. Enjoy. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ I woke up to the sound of Avril Lavigne filling the borders of my small, cozy room. As my eyes adjusted to the daylight, I checked the calendar on my cell phone which I had mistakenly left on the night before. Today was Vlad's first party in a long time, and I would have been more excited had I been more awake. Pulling myself off my bed, I slipped my robe over my silk nightie and tossed my recently-dyed mahogany hair into a low bun. Before I could walk out the door, the phone rang. "Who the hell's calling at - " I stopped myself once I realized what time it was. Smacking myself on the head, I answered the phone. "Hello?" "Hi, is Fiona there?" "Oh, hey Soph. Sorry I - " "You were supposed to call me! It's 11:45, hun. What have you been doing?" I sighed and rubbed my eyes. "Sophi, I just woke up. I think my brother screwed around with my alarm again." "Well, you were supposed to be here 15 minutes ago! We were worried..." I was never late to a party - ever. Since my alarm had gone off four hours late, though, I missed 15 minutes of Vlad's party. After hanging up with Sophi, I jumped in the shower for a quick freshening-up. While blow-drying my hair, I rummaged through my closet. I gave up after looking for 5 minutes for the outfit I had planned the night before; but as I turned to set the blow dryer down, I stubbed my toe on the rocking chair that sat right next to my closet door. Looking down to see the damage I had done, I caught a glimpse of a sheer brown fabric and denim. I felt stupid, staring at the outfit I had been looking for. As I slipped into my clothes, I remembered laying it on the chair so I wouldn't forget it. Just as I was putting the finishing touches on my hair, the phone rang again. "Hey Soph, I'm ab - " "Oh my gosh! Are you sick or something? It's been 45 minutes since I called!" "I know, Soph. I know. I had to take a shower 'cause I wasn't about to come over looking like I just woke up, and I stubbed my toe and couldn't find that outfit I was going to wear 'til five - " "Well, you better hurry up! If you don't get here in 15 minutes, Vlad won't..." I could hear people shushing her in the background. "Vlad won't what?" I asked in a suspicious tone. "Oh, he won't wait to start the party." "Why does he need to wait for me?" I asked, still suspecting some plot going on under my nose. "He wants everyone here, and you're the only one who hasn't showed up yet." "Ok... Well, I'll leave as soon as I hang up, alright?" "You better..." "Bye." I ran out the door, almost forgetting my keys. My mind was filled with the conversation I had just had with Sophi. Why was everyone shushing her? Something was definitely not right. Could it even be possible? I decided not to get my hopes up about Vlad; every time I did, I was only met with disappointment and jealousy. I arrived at the party around 1 o'clock. Vlad answered the door just as a glass shattered in the background. "Dang it, Ashlyn! I told you to wait a second!" His sister peeked around the corner with an innocent look on her face. "Fiona!" Ashlyn squealed as she ran towards me with her arms spread. I knelt down as she wrapped her arms around me as far as she could stretch them. "Ooh, you've gotten so big!" I exclaimed. "How old are you?" She stood there, hands together, with a giant grin on her face. "I'm 5 now! See?" She held up her right hand very proudly. "Wow, a whole hand? You're a big girl now!" Ashlyn tugged on Vlad's shirt. "Can I have my drink now?" Vlad took her hand as he shut the door behind me. "Everyone's outside." As I opened the door, I heard Ashlyn and Vlad whispering. "Vlad," she said in an impatient tone, "when are we going to - " "Later, Ash. I'll let you know, okay?" I just laughed and stepped outside. To be honest, I had almost skipped the party. Since that night at Sohpi's house, things had been, well, different between Vlad and me. We still talked, but never made eye contact. Everything about him felt weird - I couldn't even say hi without feeling nauseous. So when he invited me to a party, I became extremely suspicious and uneasy. I told everyone I wasn't coming - I even explained it to them; and somehow, they were able to convince me to go. They said that he felt bad for making me feel this way, that he knew I wondered about what was going on between us and wanted to make sure I knew that we were still friends. I thought it was sweet and made me feel somewhat better, even though I knew that as soon as I saw him again, everything around would become a blur, and the tension and nausea would come flooding back; I was right. It wasn't until I stepped outside into the warm sun and cool breeze that I felt better. I made my way across the deck that overlooked the backyard, which spanned over quite some distance. As I headed down the stairs, Sophi looked up and smiled. "Fi!" "Soph!" I shouted back as Mercy and Jo turned towards me. "Hey Mercy! Hey Jo!" Mel peeked his head around in front of Jo, who was casually sitting on his lap. As I neared the collection of lawn chairs scattered in front of a gazebo which sat near the large pond in the back, Vlad opened the back door of the house. "Snacks are ready!" he yelled as he brought out a tray and some plates. "What the hell's the green stuff?" asked Mel as Vlad set the food on the table around which the chairs were scattered. "It's humus. Just eat it. We've also got cheese and crackers, pita bread for 'the green stuff', and a veggie platter for the health freak," he said as he shot a glance at Mercy. "What can I say? I love veggies." "Amen to that," I chimed in, grabbing a slice of pita bread and tearing off a piece to dip in the humus. "Wow, this is pretty good. So what all have I missed?" "Not much," Jo replied. "Mel's become my chair, and Soph almost strangled Vlad, but that's nothing new. So really, you haven't missed anything." "That's good to hear. So, since this is a New Year's party, how late are we going to be staying? I presume I won't get home 'til it's techincally tomorrow." "Whenever y'all want to leave is fine with me," Vlad directed more at the group than at me. "I'm surprised my parents are even letting people stay past 9. I think that's a first." We all smiled as we tried to figure out something to do. "Hey, I know something we could do," Mel chimed in after a long, silent pause. We all leaned in closer, as if it would make his plan seem better than it really was. He sat for a second with a dumbfounded look on his face, before coming back to reality. "Oh, wait, nevermind. No I don't." We all sighed and muttered impolite words under our breaths. "So what were you thinking of?" I asked, still not making eye contact. He had a worried look on his face, barely imperceptible. "Oh, it was nothing." "No, seriously! What was it? There's obviously nothing going on right now, so anything anyone can think of is worth a shot." He got very serious. "Fi, drop it," he said in a hushed voice. "It was stupid and would just turn out badly." "Vlad," Jo chimed in, "read my face." "Har har," he replied with a smirk. "OH. Ok. Hey, can you come here for a second?" He got up and walked towards the door, not stopping to wait for Jo, who followed suit. We all sat there, just staring at each other. I knew everyone else suspected or knew what was going on. "So what was that all about?" Everyone kept a surprisingly straight face, even Mel. "I don't know," Mercy chimed in. Everyone nodded their heads. "Alright guys, I know something's up and I'm being kept out of it. Spill the beans." Mel flipped out. "Hey, we don't know anything." "Wow, way to give it away, genius," I replied. "So what's the scoop? Does Vlad have a girlfriend or something? You know I'm not gonna go all 'Trigger' on him." I could swear I heard someone mumble "Not yet", but then again, I really didn't want to take my chances and make myself look stupid and self-centered. "We told you, nothing's going on," Mercy said in her normal sweet voice. "I guess he's trying to steal Jo from Mel or something." Everyone laughed. "Hey," Mel said, "that's not cool." Mercy smiled. "I'm sorry. So anyway, what are we going to do? It's only been..." She paused as she looked at her watch. "An hour since Fi got here! Holy wow." Vlad and Jo walked back to the group and sat down. "So, did we miss anything?" he asked. "Not a thing," I jumped in. I sat back in my seat, aware of what I thought was a sure sign to everyone that I liked him. Many hours passed. The sky outside was turning a gorgeous shade of yellow to orange to pink, and the shadows of the trees fell across the lawn. We were all sitting in Vlad's room, the door shut and a small lamp lighting the room from a corner. "Hey guys," Vlad interrupted, "I know it's 7, which is probably dinner time for most of us, but is anyone really hungry?" We all shook our heads. "I didn't think so. Hey Soph, what time was Leon supposed to get here?" Just as Sophi was about to answer, the doorbell rang. "I guess right now!" she said with a smile as she got off the bed and walked out the door. Even over the noise of the television and children running around, we could hear her yell "Leon!" as she opened the door. We continued our conversations where we had stopped. A minute later, Sophi walked into the room and sat in a dark corner, her face low and red with embarrassment. "Where's Leon?" I asked. She looked up with an akward grin on her face. "You guys, I'm so stupid. I yelled 'Leon' before I even saw who it was. It was the freaking pizza guy! He gave me a really weird look." We all laughed at her blonde moment, and another doorbell was barely audible over the noise. Vlad walked towards the door. "I think I'll get it this time," he said with a smirk. He returned after a few minutes, peeking his head around the corner. "Hey, Soph, it wasn't Leon, but I think this guy's just as good." As he walked into the room, the visitor followed behind. "Leon!" Sophi squealed as she jumped up and ran across the room into his arms. Vlad sat back down on his bed and the five of us continued to talk as Sophi filled Leon in about the past 7 hours. She eventually ran out of things to say, and found a comfortable spot pressed against Leon's side on the floor. "So what are we going to do now?" she asked. "How about 'Spin-the-bottle'?" Leon playfully suggested as he pecked her on the cheek, making her giggle. "How about not," Mercy said uncomfortablly. I chimed in to help break the akward silence that now filled the room. "Hey, did you guys see that show last night..." The sky continued to change hue from gray-blue to light navy to black, but no one noticed as the hours flew by. No one even glanced at the clock til a knock on the bedroom door broke our laughter. "What's up?" Vlad asked as he opened the door to reveal his droopy-eyed mom. "Everyone's asleep, so you guys need to keep it down. It's 5 'til midnight, and I thought you guys might like the downstairs to yourselves." "Thanks, mom," he replied. "Good night." We headed downstairs and quietly walked into the livingroom, which was lit by a single lamp as well. Turning on the t.v. which was conveniently set to the yearly Times Square countdown, Vlad turned the lamp off, letting the glow from the t.v. give the room a unique ambiance. Everyone sat down as if in a seating arrangement; Sophi and Leon sat on the large chair on the left, Jo and Mel sat side-by-side on the loveseat to the right, and Mercy, Vlad, and I sat on the sofa, respectively. I leaned against the right arm and brought up my legs between Vlad and me, giving myself space to hide my inevitable tears. The clock at the bottom of the screen read 11:59, and the announcer said enthusiastically, "Only 30 seconds left! Find that special someone to kiss before it's too late..." "We don't need anyone, right guys?" Mercy said, looking at Vlad and me. "Sure," I replied, letting out more of my sad feelings than I had intended. As the giant clock on the t.v. showed 00:00:10, I adjusted myself to a normal seating position and took a quick sip of my water. I tried to keep in the tears as the clock counted down, reminding myself that this wasn't the first year I had been without a date. I sat there with everyone else, saying "5, 4, 3, 2, 1" and as the moment I feared most came, I shut my eyes. I imagined myself sitting in that same place, same time, with the same people around me. I wondered and tried to picture what it would have been like if Vlad had just asked me that night at Sohpi's house, and it would be us kissing to the thought of a new year, my arms around his neck and his around my waist. It seemed so real; it was as if I could really feel the warmth from his kiss. Thinking it was over, I slowly opened my eyes. But instead of seeing lovers kiss on t.v., I saw the face of my own. The feeling of Vlad's lips against mine was real; I was no longer dreaming. Remembering the outcome of the last incident, however, I pulled away gently and ran outside. I continued to run 'til I reached the gazebo steps, throwing myself at the half-open side after reaching the landing. I stared up at the star-filled sky, wondering why I kept letting myself get into these situations. It was bad enough last time when I threw myself at him; but this time he came to me. As thoughts continued to fly through my head, I heard someone climbing up the steps. A sudden warmth came over me as a blanket fell over my shoulders. I discretely touched my lips to make sure I wasn't falling mad again. "It's cold out here. You could get sick." I turned around to find Vlad's calming face glowing like a beacon of light. I stood there staring at the ground, not knowing what to say. "I know you think I'm a kiss-and-leave kind of guy," he began as he put his hands on my hips, "but I'm not." I kept my head down, determined to fight to the end. Secretly - or so I thought - I was growing weak in the knees. Gently putting his hand below my chin, he raised my eyes to his. In the sweetest voice I had ever heard, he said, "I want you to be mine." I stood silent for a second, amazed at how such simple words could make me feel so high. I pressed my lips against his, wrapping arms and blanket around us. We continued to kiss in the starlight, an understood "Yes" to the man I felt so connected to in that instant. I grabbed his hands and led him to the only bench on the gazebo. He pulled off the cushions and unfolded the bench into what looked like a sofa-bed. Putting a pillow at one end, he lay down, pulling me between him and the back, where I would be warmest. I dragged the heavy blanket over both of us as I lay my head on his chest. I closed my eyes, and slept peacefully under the stars in the arms of the one I loved. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ © Lauren E. Parker Comments appreciated. :D
